definitions.definition: An act of moving back and forth , swinging , or waving ; a flutter , a tremble .

subdefinitions.definition: A state of beginning to weaken or showing signs of weakening in resolve ; a falter .
A state of feeling or showing doubt or indecision ; a vacillation .

main_definition: An act of moving back and forth , swinging , or waving ; a flutter , a tremble .

definitions.definition: One who waves their arms , or causes something to swing or wave.
examples: I felt encouraged by all the enthusiastic wavers in the crowd.
The Fourth of July brings out all the flag wavers .
Johnny is such a little waver ; everyone who passes by receives his preferred greeting.

subdefinitions.definition: A person who specializes in treating hair to make it wavy .
A tool used to make hair wavy.

definitions.definition: ( printing , historical ) In full waver roller : a roller which places ink on the inking table of a printing press with a back and forth , waving motion .
( obsolete ) Synonym of waverer ( “ one who feels or shows doubt or indecision ; a vacillator ” ) .

main_definition: One who waves their arms , or causes something to swing or wave.
secondary_definitions: ( printing , historical ) In full waver roller : a roller which places ink on the inking table of a printing press with a back and forth , waving motion .
( obsolete ) Synonym of waverer ( “ one who feels or shows doubt or indecision ; a vacillator ” ) .

definitions.definition: A sapling or other young tree left standing when other trees around it have been felled .

main_definition: ( obsolete except UK , dialectal , dated ) A sapling or other young tree left standing when other trees around it have been felled .
